src:
Poklonili so se Davu Karničarju
Na Jezerskem drugi večer lovskih pesmi in melodij. V pevskem zboru iz Železne Kaple prepeva tudi njihov župan.
05 Nov 2019, 20:24 by Janez Kuhar



Lovski moški pevski zbor iz Železne Kaple FOTOgrafije: Janez Kuhar



Ljudske pevke Društva upokojencev Jezersko pod vodstvom Anice Jakopič



Častni gostje na lovskem večeru: župan občine Jezersko Andrej Karničar, podpredsednica ZLD Gorenjske Janja Lukanc in župan občine Železna Kapla Franz Jozef Smrtnik


JEZERSKO – V dvorani Korotan na Jezerskem so zadnjo oktobrsko soboto organizirali drugi večer Lovskih pesmi in melodij. Lovsko-kulturno prireditev so priredili in omogočili občina Jezersko, Zveza lovskih družin Gorenjske, Lovsko pevsko društvo Železna Kapla in Lovska družina Jezersko. V programu, ki ga je domiselno povezovala Slavi Bučan, so sodelovali Lovski pevski zbor iz Škofje Loke, lovski zbor iz Železne Kaple, lovski rogisti iz Selc, domači pevski zbor Ljudske pevke Društva upokojencev Jezersko, ki ga vodi Anica Jakopič, ter Marko in Tobija Smrtnik s harmoniko in baritonom. Začetek večera so naznanili lovski rogisti iz Selc s skladbo Klic na lov.
Vzorno sodelovanje z matično deželo
Prisotne je nagovoril starešina LD Jezersko Franci Ekar, spomnili so se tudi dveh preminulih članov, Dava Karničarja, ki bi prav 26. oktobra praznoval rojstni dan, in Damjana Smrtnika, ki se je usodno ponesrečil pri lovu na gamsa v snežno ledenih strminah Vernikovega Grintovca. Župan Jezerskega Andrej Karničar je čestital organizatorjem in izvajalcem tega uspešnega večera. Obiskovalce je navdušil lovski pevski zbor iz Železne Kaple, ki je nastal leta 1976 in mu odtlej predseduje Erni Županc. Zbor ima od vsega začetka iskrene prijateljske stike in sodeluje z lovci iz Slovenije, kar je izjemna vrednota. V njem poje železnokapelski župan Franz Jozef Smrtnik, pevec v njem je bil tudi njegov zdaj pokojni oče Franz. Navzoče sta pozdravila župan Železne Kaple Franz Jozef Smrtnik, ki se je zahvali LD Jezersko, da s tako voljo in pripravljenostjo izvaja kulturna lovska poslanstva, in podpredsednica Zveze lovskih družin Gorenjske Janja Lukanc, ki je organizatorjem čestitala za izvedbo večera.Lovski loški pevski zbor prepeva že trideset let, vodi ga Tone Habjan, ki je ob jubileju skupaj z rogisti iz Selc izdal zgoščenko Lovske pesmi in lovski običaji. Pri njih je prepeval tudi nedavno umrli Janez Dolenc, pevec Fantov s Praprotna.​Večer je v zadovoljstvo obiskovalcev, gostov in izvajalcev izjemno uspel, druženje nastopajočih pa se je nadaljevalo v Lovskem domu na Jezerskem, v katerem je prav tako odmevala lovska pesem. 


Ljudske pevke Društva upokojencev Jezersko pod vodstvom Anice Jakopič



Častni gostje na lovskem večeru: župan občine Jezersko Andrej Karničar, podpredsednica ZLD Gorenjske Janja Lukanc in župan občine Železna Kapla Franz Jozef Smrtnik
text:
They bowed to Dav Karnicar
In Jezersko the second evening of hunting songs and tunes. Their mayor also sings in the choir of the Iron Chapel.
05 Nov 2019, 19:24 by Janez Kuhar



Hunting Male Choir from Zelezna Kapla PHOTO: Janez Kuhar



People's Singers of the Jezersko Retirement Society led by Anica Jakopič



Honorary guests at the Hunting Evening: Mayor of Jezersko municipality Andrej Karničar, Vice-president of the ZLD of Gorenjska Janja Lukanc and Mayor of Železna Kapla Franz Jozef Death


JEZERSKO - The second evening of Hunting Songs and Melodies was organized at the Korotan Hall in Jezersko on the last October Saturday. The hunting and cultural event was organized and made possible by the municipality of Jezersko, the Union of Hunting Families of Gorenjska, the Železna Kapla Hunting Singing Society and the Jezersko Hunting Family. The program, imaginatively linked by Slavi Bučan, included the Hunting Choir from Skofja Loka, the Hunting Choir from Železna Kapla, the Hunting Horns from Selce, the Choir of the People's Singers of the Jezersko Retirement Society led by Anica Jakopič, and Marko and Tobi Morton with accordion and baritone. The start of the evening was announced by hunting antlers from Selce with the song Call to Hunt.
Model cooperation with the mother country
The present was addressed by LD Jezersko, the elder Franci Ekar, and they also remembered two deceased members, Dav Karničar, who would have celebrated his birthday on October 26th, and Damjan Smrtnik, who was fatally injured while hunting for chamois in the snow-covered slopes of Vernik Grintovec. Jezersky Mayor Andrej Karničar congratulated the organizers and performers of this successful evening. The visitors were impressed by the choir from Železna Kapla, which was created in 1976 and has since been chaired by Erni Županc. The choir has sincere sincere friendly contacts and cooperated with hunters from Slovenia, which is an exceptional value. He is sung by the Iron Chapel Mayor Franz Joseph Death, and his now deceased father Franz is also a singer. The Mayor of Železna Kapla, Franz Jozef Smrtnik, greeted the attendees, thanking LD Jezersko for carrying out cultural hunting missions with such willingness and readiness, and Janja Lukanc, Vice-President of the Gorenjska Hunting Families Association, who congratulated the organizers on the evening. For thirty years, it has been run by Tone Habjan, who, along with the horns from Selce, published a CD of Hunting Poems and Hunting Customs. The recently deceased Janez Dolenc, a singer of the Boys from Praprotn, also sang with them, and the evening was a great success for the visitors, guests and performers.


People's Singers of the Jezersko Retirement Society led by Anica Jakopič



Honorary guests at the Hunting Evening: Mayor of Jezersko municipality Andrej Karničar, Vice-president of the ZLD of Gorenjska Janja Lukanc and Mayor of Železna Kapla Franz Jozef Death
